GisplayOptions
description: This class will contain all the options available on the Gisplay API.

params.description: The attribute to be mapped.

params.name: userOptions.colorScheme

params.name: userOptions.numberOfClasses
params.description: Number of classes to be used on the map Legend.

params.name: userOptions.classBreaksMethod
params.description: Algorithm to be used by the API to calculate classes intervals.

params.name: userOptions.classBreaks
params.description: Class intervals.

params.name: userOptions.interactive
params.description: Show pop-up when the user clicks on a Feature.

params.name: userOptions.showPropertiesOnClick
params.description: Show pop-up when the user clicks on a Feature.

params.name: userOptions.showLegend
params.description: Show map Legend.

params.name: userOptions.minuend
params.description: The minimum property of the GeoJSON feature object.

params.name: userOptions.subtrahend
params.description: The property to subtract from minuend.

params.name: userOptions.legendTitle
params.description: Legend title for the Legend.

params.name: userOptions.showLoader
params.description: Show loader when loading data.

params.name: userOptions.useCustomMapService
params.description: Use custom map service.

params.name: userOptions.minPointSize
params.description: Minimum point size.

params.name: userOptions.maxPointSize
params.description: Maximum point size.

params.name: userOptions.sizeByClass
params.description: Specify the size of the dots on a PSymbols Map using classes.

params.name: userOptions.memorySaver
params.description: Save memory on Dot Maps.

params.name: userOptions.colorSchemeId
params.description: The color scheme id to use.

params.name: userOptions.legendOnClickFunction
params.description: Function to be called when the user clicks on a Legend class.

params.name: userOptions.mapOnClickFunction
params.description: Function to be called when the user clicks on the Map (on a Feature).

params.name: userOptions.alpha
params.description: Alpha to be used in WebGL.

params.name: userOptions.maxFeatures
params.description: The max number of features to be displayed.

params.name: userOptions.numberOfLegendItems
params.description: The number of Legend items (Used on PSymbols Map).

params.name: userOptions.intensity
params.description: Intensity for Heat Map.

params.name: userOptions.legendPosition
params.description: The Legend position(br=bottom right).

params.name: userOptions.legendNumberFormat
params.description: Number of decimal numbers to show on the numerical values of the Legend.

params.name: userOptions.tileSize
params.description: Size of each background map tile.

name: attr
description: The attribute to be mapped.

name: colorScheme
description: Array of colors to be used by the API.

name: numberOfClasses
classBreaksMethod
description:
Algorithm to be used by the API to calculate classes intervals. 
Defaults to quantile if the user does not provide any or if it provides one that isn't on the list of available algorithms.
Available options are 'quantile', 'equidistant', 'k-means'.

name: classBreaks
description: Class intervals. If this is defined then numberOfClasses and classBreakMethod are ignored.

name: interactive
description: When we click on a feature that is on the map, show properties of said Feature or not.

name: showPropertiesOnClick
description: Properties and description to be shown when the user clicks on a Feature.

name: showLegend
description: Whether or not to show the map Legend.

name: minuend
description: The minimum property of the GeoJSON feature object. Used on Change Map.

name: subtrahend
description: The property of the GeoJSON feature object to subtract from the minimum. Used on Change Map.

name: legendTitle
description: The title to be used on the Legend. Third option is used for Change Map.

name: showLoader
description: Whether to show or not the loader when we the API is loading the needed data.

name: useCustomMapService
description:
True when the user wants to use another background map service than those who are supported by default by the API.
If this is true then the user should send the custom map service when creating the new Map.

name: minPointSize
description: The minimum size of the points to be drawn on the Map. Will be used on PSymbols and maybe on Dot Map/Heat Map.

name: maxPointSize
description:
The maximum size of the points to be drawn on the Map. Will be used on PSymbols. The dot with highest value 
on the features will have the size given by the user.

name: sizeByClass
description: If the user wants to specify the size of the dots on a PSymbols Map using classes, this attribute should be true.

name: memorySaver
description:
If false each feature will have it's own WebGLBuffer, otherwise the geometry will be grouped creating one WebGLBuffer by
Aesthetic class. As the name implies allows memory saving and with this improves performance in lower end devices. 
Only Available/Relevant to Dot Maps.

name: colorSchemeId
description: Allows the user to choose the color scheme id to be used to choose from the list of defaults color shemes availabe on the Map to be created.

name: legendOnClickFunction
description: Function to be called when the user clicks on a Legend class. This function should receive an object of type Aesthetic.

name: mapOnClickFunction
description: Function to be called when the user clicks on the Map (on a Feature). This function should receive an array, which are the Feature properties.

name: alpha
description:
Alpha to be used in WebGL.
0 means fully transparent <-> 1 fully opaque.

name: maxFeatures
description:
The max number of features to be displayed. If not given by the user then it is the maximum numnber allowed.
Number.MAX_VALUE = 1.79E+308

name: numberOfLegendItems
description: The number of legend items. Used for PSymbols Map.

name: tileSize
description: The size of each background map tile. Used by most background map providers is 256.

name: isDynamic
description:
If it is dynamic or not. When dynamic is set to true it will join all Features on one Aesthetic class in the same Feature and this way it can draw all elements at once.
It's the inverse of the memorySaver value.

name: legendToggle
description: Enable/Disable Legend toggle.

name: intensity
description: Intensity of a heat map. Higher values of intensity means more red in the end color. Otherwise more green.
deprecated: Not used ATM, should probably be used for Heat Maps.

name: legendPosition
description: The user defined position of the Legend over the map. Allowed positions tl, tr, bl, br.
deprecated: Currently not in use. Maybe implement later.

name: legendNumberFormat
description: Number of decimal numbers to show on the numerical values of the Legend.
deprecated: Currently not in use. Maybe implement later.

name: getAvailableClassBreaksMethods
description: Returns the available class break methods.

unknown.tagValue: {string[]} - All available class break methods under Gisplay API.

return.description: All available class break methods under Gisplay API.

Aesthetic

Inverts this Aesthetic element state in the Legend object.

name: src/Gisplay/Maps/Map.js
Map
description:
This class contains the Map class which represents the current map.
Each map has a group of functions available. There is only one map yet(maybe there will be two if we want to compare two).

name: constructor
description: Map constructor. All Map subclasses should call this first with super(...).
todo: With the type of the map we can do an if statement inside constructor to use or not some of the variables.

params.name: bgmap
params.description: Background map.

params.name: geometry
params.description: Geometry read from the file.

params.name: userOptions
params.description: The user defined options.

name: treepoints
description:
This object holds for each point it's long, lat and associated properties. 
This points will be used by k-d Tree. And k-d Tree is used to find the closest point to where the user clicked.

types: Array<{lon: number, lat: number, properties: JSON}>

name: tempAestheticPoints
description: Holds the points for each Aesthethic object.

name: aesthetics
description: Aesthetic objects that were saved.

name: geometry
description: JSON object with the geometry that was read from the file.

name: id
description: This map unique identifier.

name: kdtree
description: KdTree object to hold that will be used to calculate the closest point to the coordinates where the user made a click.

name: rtree
description: RBush(Rtree implementation) that is used to calculate the polygon closest to the coordinates where the user made a click.

name: hasPolygons
description: Polygons do/do not exist. This is used to know if it to create a rtree or not on buildTrees method.

name: max
description:
This is the maixmum value found on the dataset. The final value for the break. E.g. [2, 37[ 37 is the max. 
Used for PSymbol Map and Change Map because on those maps it's important to take in consideration this values to define the Feature color.

name: min
description:
This is the minimum value found on the dataset. The initial value for the break. E.g. [2, 37[ 2 is the min.
Used for PSymbol Map and Change Map because on those maps it's important to take in consideration this values to define the Feature color.

name: loadOptions
description:
M1) Loads user and default options. For each case if it isn't provided by the user, then it uses
the default option. 1st method to be called.

params.name: userOptions
params.description: Options given by the user.

params.name: bgmap
params.description: The background map provider.

name: gisplayOptions
description: All the options available in the Gisplay API.

name: bGMap
description:
This is the Gisplay API Background map wrapper. It contains the background map provider object to access it's methods (zoom, coordinates,etc).
This map(Gisplay Map) will  be drawn over the background map(bGMap).

name: showLoader
description: M2) Calls the Background Map Wrapper to create the loader to be used later when the user feeds data to the API.

name: initializeCanvasAndEvents
description: M3) Initializes the API by: creating canvas, the WebGL program and setting up all needed events.

name: createCanvas
description: M4) Creates a canvas element and WebGL associated information.

properties.name: _webgl.projection
properties.description: The projection to be used. Deprecated in favor of better projection to work with multiple map background providers.

name: setupEvents
description:
M8) Setup all events used by the API. Right now the API uses: drag, zoom and click events. 
This events will be fired by the background map provider and we can use them to draw(zoom and pan) or alert information(click).
Pan/Zoom = move, click = click
rtree will be used to find the closest polygon to the where the clicked event happened.
kdtree will be used to find the closest point to where the click event happened.
todo: This method is doing uneccessary job if the user set interative to false and mapOnClickFunction is undefined.

params.name: mappos
params.description: This map id.

name: searchRTree
description: Search the rtree for the closest polygon from the lng, lat that was clicked.

params.name: lng
params.description: The longitude of the click.

params.name: lat
params.description: The latitude of the click.

name: searchKdTree
description: Search the rtree for the closest point from the lng, lat that was clicked.

params.name: lon
params.description: The longitude of the click.

params.name: lat
params.description: The latitude of the click.

name: makeMap
description: M9) Method that executes all the process associated with the creation of the thematic map.

name: preProcessData
description:
M11) Creates Aesthetic objects. If there's the need to calculate the class intervals,
the method calcClassBreaks is called

params.name: geojson
params.description: GeoJSON object.

params.name: numberOfClasses
params.description: Number of classes that the Legend will contain.

params.name: classBreaksMethod
params.description: Algorithm to be used to calculate class breaks. Only used it class breaks are not given by the user.

params.name: colorscheme
params.description: Color scheme to be used by this map.

name: aesthetics
description: All the Aesthetics that were read from the GeoJSON file.

name: calcClassBreaks
description:
M12) Calculates the class breaks using the algorithm given(k-means, quantile or equidistant). 
There will be as many class breaks as number of classes(numberOfClasses) given as input.

unknown.tagValue: {number[]} - The class breaks resulting from the use of the given algorithm and the number of classes.

params.name: numberValues
params.description: The data values that will be used to be compute the breaks.

params.name: classBreakMethod
params.description: The algorithm to use to calculate the class breaks.

params.name: numberOfClasses
params.description: Number of classes the result expects.

return.description: The class breaks resulting from the use of the given algorithm and the number of classes.

name: loadGeoJSON
description:
M13) Loads GeoJSON object that came from the file uploaded by the user. 
Extracts the Features present in the geometry object and inserts them in Aesthetic object(s)
This method will create and insert features to Aesthetic objects and build trees of relationships between points or polygons.

params.name: geojson
params.description: GeoJSON read from the file.

name: createAndInsertFeature
description: M14) Creates a Feature and then calls a method to insert said Feature in one or more Aesthetic objects.

params.name: featureId
params.description: Id of the Feature.

params.name: geometry
params.description: GeoJSON Geometry Object.

params.name: properties
params.description: GeoJSON properties Object.

name: processPolygon
description: M15) Deals with polygon triangulation.

unknown.tagValue: {{triangles: Array<number>, vertices: Array<number>}} - The triangles and vertices calculated by earcut triangulation. The vertices are the outside of the polygon, the triangles are the inside.

params.name: polygon
params.description: The geometry and properties of the polygon.

return.description: The triangles and vertices calculated by earcut triangulation. The vertices are the outside of the polygon, the triangles are the inside.

name: latLongToPixelXY
description: M16) Converts geographic coordinates(latitude, longitude) to canvas coordinate pixels.

unknown.tagValue: {x: number, y: number} - canvas coordinate system pixels.

params.name: longitude
params.description: The longitude.

params.name: latitude
params.description: The latitude.

return.description: canvas coordinate system pixels.

name: insertFeature
description: M17) Inserts the Feature into one or more Aesthetic objects. If the Feature does not fit in any Aesthetic then does nothing.

params.name: id
params.description: The Feature id.

params.name: properties
params.description: The Feature properties.

params.name: triangles
params.description: Triangles, each in one WebGLBuffer.

params.name: borders
params.description: Borders, each in one WebGLBuffer.

params.name: points
params.description: Points, each in one WebGLBuffer.

name: fitFeature
description: M18) Returns an array of Aesthetic ids that tells us the objects where the Feature belongs.

unknown.tagValue: {Array<number>} - The Aesthetic ids where the Feature belongs.

params.name: properties
params.description: The Feature properties

return.description: The Aesthetic ids where the Feature belongs.

name: buildTrees
description:
M19) Receives the dataset as parameter. This dataset in each row contains geometry and associated properties, then it creates one tree
either for points or polygons. This tree can be k-d Treee or RBush(RTree)

name: insertGroupedFeature
description:
M20) Similar to insertFeature, in this case inserts a group of Features like it was only one.
It creates one WebGLBuffer with all the points instead of one WebGLBuffer per point.
This method should only be used when we already grouped the Features by Aesthetic class (fitFeature() method).
This method exists to provide one alternative less expensive in terms of memory for low end devices.
Used only on Dot Map because on those we can easily end up with millions of different Features.

params.name: id
params.description: Aesthethics id.

params.name: triangles
params.description: Not used ?

params.name: borders
params.description: Not used ?

params.name: points
params.description: All the points for the Aesthethic object in one WebGLBuffer.

name: buildLegend
description:
M17) Creates a Legend element suitable for polygons based on the Aesthethic objects.
Should be overriden by subclasses.

name: clear
description: M22) Clear current buffers to preset values.

name: drawTriangles
description:
M23) Receiving an Aesthetics object, draws the triangles contained in it's Features,
using the color that the Aesthethics object has.

params.name: aes
params.description: The Aesthetic object.

name: drawBorders
description:
M24) Receiving an Aesthetics object, draws the borders contained in it's Features, 
aplying the color specified in the Aeshteic object for the line color(Aeshteic.strokeColor).

params.name: aes
params.description: The Aesthetic object.

name: drawContinuousPolygons
description:
M25) Receiving an Aesthetics object, draws the borders contained in it's Features, 
aplying the filling color calculated using the attribute and the color scheme.

params.name: aes
params.description: The Aesthetic object.

name: drawPoints
description:
M26) Receiving an Aesthetics object, draws the points contained in it's Features, 
aplying the values specified in that Aesthetic object visual variables (color and size).

params.name: aes
params.description: The Aesthetic object.

name: drawProportionalPoints
description:
M27) Receiving an Aesthetics object, draws the points contained in it's Features, 
aplying the color specified in the Aeshteic object for the line color(Aeshteic.strokeColor) 
and the size of the point is based on the attribute value and the specified limits.

params.name: aes
params.description: The Aesthetic object.

name: setMatrices
description:
This method will set all matrices needed to compute each point/vertex position. This will use the 
Before sending the matrix to webGL we change the last column transformation in X and Y to the last row X and Y 
because WebGL is column major. See MMatrix[6] =...

name: scaleProjection
description:
M28) Scale matrix with the given x(scaleX) and y(scaleY) values.
Scaling x and y, which is just scaling first two rows of matrix

params.name: scaleX
params.description: Scale in X axis.

params.name: scaleY
params.description: Scale in Y axis.

name: translateProjection
description: M29) The translation is performed in the last row of the matrix.

params.name: matrix
params.description: The matrix to hold the result.

params.name: tx
params.description: Translation in X axis.

params.name: ty
params.description: Translation in Y axis.

name: draw
description: M21) Draw map function. Must be overriden by subclasses.

name: defaults
description: M10) Defaults for each map. Subclasses should override this method.

name: processData
description:
This function should be implemented by any subclass that wants to use another way of processing data.
By default it loads GeoJSON but if the user wants to load another type of data it should do so by implementing this method.
A function similar to loadGeoJSON should also be implemented

params.name: data
params.description:
Dataset to be used. 
TODO: Add static to this method.

name: src/Gisplay/Maps/WebglUtils.js
WebGLUtils
description:
Class with static methods that will help with WebGL related stuff(Matrices, web mercator projection and shaders).
Always remeber WebGL is column major when reading the matrix code.

name: webMercatorProjection
description: Calculates the scale and offset(X and Y) for the Web Mercator projection.

unknown.tagValue: {{scale: number, offsetX: number, offsetY: number}} - Returns the scale, offsetX and offsetY of the point given using the Web Mercator projection.

params.name: longitudeCenter
params.description: Longitude of the given position.

params.name: latitudeCenter
params.description: Latitude of the given position.

params.name: zoom
params.description: Current zoom level of the background map.

params.name: tileSize
params.description: The size of each tile in the background map. Usually is 256. If different should be given in the API options.

params.name: width
params.description: Width of the current canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: Height of the current canvas.

return.description: Returns the scale, offsetX and offsetY of the point given using the Web Mercator projection.

name: finalMatrix
description: This is the result matrix from multiplication M1*M2*M3

unknown.tagValue: {Float32Array} The resulting matrix (M1*M2*M3) in a single matrix.

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale calculated with WebMercator projection.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the canvas.

params.name: offsetX
params.description: The offsetX calculated with WebMercator projection.

params.name: offsetY
params.description: The offsetY calculated with WebMercator projection.

return.description: The resulting matrix (M1*M2*M3) in a single matrix.

name: generateShadersSourceCode
description: Creates shaders(Vertex + Fragment) source code.

unknown.tagValue: {{vertexCode: string, fragmentCode: string}} - The code for the vertex and fragment shaders.

return.description: The code for the vertex and fragment shaders.

name: createAndCompileShader
description: Creates and compiles a shader.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of shader. Options are: VERTEX_SHADER or FRAGMENT_SHADER;

params.name: source_code
params.description: The shader source code.

params.name: webgl
params.description: Webgl object used by the Map class.

return.description: The shader(vertex of fragment).

name: createWebGLProgram
description:
Initializes:
1)WebGLProgram, 2) Generates shadders, 3) Attaches shaders to the program, 4) links program, 5) uses program.

name: createM1
description:
Creates the M1 Matrix. 
This matrix is used to convert the result pixel to a position between 0 and 1(2/width and 2/height scaling) 
and after that convert to a position between -1 and 1(-1 translation).

unknown.tagValue: {Float32Array} The matrix M1 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

params.name: width
params.description: Width of the canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: Height of the canvas.

return.description: The matrix M1 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

name: createM2
description:
Creates the M2 Matrix.
This matrix is used to calculate the positions of the pixel using the Web Mercator projection.

unknown.tagValue: {Float32Array} The matrix M2 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

return.description: The matrix M2 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

name: createM3
description:
Creates the M3 Matrix.
This matrix is used to calculate the positions of the pixel using the Web Mercator projection.

unknown.tagValue: {Float32Array}  The matrix M3 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

return.description: The matrix M3 to be used to calculate each point/vertex position.

name: matrixMultiplication
description: Performs Matrix multiplication between two matrices.

unknown.tagValue: {Float32Array} a matrix which is the result of multiplying M1 by M2.

params.name: M1
params.description: The M1 matrix.

params.name: M2
params.description: The M2 matrix.

return.description: a matrix which is the result of multiplying M1 by M2.

pointInPolygon
description:
Exports a `PolygonLookup` constructor, which constructs a data-structure for
quickly finding the polygon that a point intersects in a (potentially very
large) set.

params.name: featureCollection
params.description:
An optional GeoJSON feature collection
   to pass to `loadFeatureCollection()`.
